title: Heart and liver problems...
text:
resulting from heart and liver problems, coroner reveals By Emma Lake 7th March 2017, 12:51 pm Updated: 7th March 2017, 1:11 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments GEORGE Michael died of natural causes as a result of heart and liver problems, a coroner has revealed. 
  the pop legend suffered from dilated cardiomyopathy with myocarditis and fatty liver. In a statement the coroner said: “Inquires

Astonishing moment all hell breaks loose as Tesco shoppers scramble to get their hands on cut-price veg SUNNIN' ON CROC OF THE BAY Hundreds of alligators gather at Florida watering hole for sunbathing session 'MUMMY, WE'RE GOING TO DIE!' Moment gunman opens fire at car with mum and her two kids inside in horrific daylight drive-by shooting 'I'VE NEVER SMELT ANYTHING LIKE IT' Mum's shock as horrific smell coming from her little girl was massive piece of sponge that had been jammed up her nose for two WEEKS BRITAIN'S POT TALENT Chubby son dancer from BGT finalists Stavros Flatley arrested over 'cannabis factory' 
Investigations into his death had delayed his family’s funeral plans. 
An early post-mortem has come back as “inconclusive” with police saying his death was “unexplained but not suspicious”. 
Kenny Goss, George’s partner of 15 years, revealed he flew to the UK from Texas to comfort the singer’s family. 
Kenny, 58, said: “I think his body just gave up. All these years, it was just weak.”
